page.title: 19Chilworth local history
page.content:
The{Gunpowder Works}were used from the 17th to the 20th century. An explosion in 1901 partially destroyed the buildings, killing six people and shattering the windows of Chilworth Manor half a mile away. The gunpowder was used in the Civil and First World Wars. The{Railway Station}is 150 years old and the railway line transported soldiers, ammunition and aircraft fuel during the First World War.
{Chilworth Manor}was a monastery in the 11th century and was recorded in the original Domesday Book. It has an interesting three-tiered garden. {Postford House}was used in the Great War as a hospital and was visited frequently by Queen Mary. John Evelyn lived there and designed the rose garden.
